creator: robert@pophost.com
text:
I get a core dump when trying to run apache, no matter what the configuration or
threading type.

#0  0x40079361 in apr_shm_create (m=0x3d306c5a, reqsize=0, 
    filename=0x2634 <Address 0x2634 out of bounds>, pool=0x2634) at shm.c:410
410             *m = new_m;

This is Linux 2.2.19pre13ext3 SMP, running on a dual cpu machine.
all modules enabled, shared=max.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text: Can you post a full backtrace from gdb ("where" command should do it)?

creator: robert@pophost.com
text:
All I get is:
#0  0x40079361 in apr_shm_create (m=0x3d363074, reqsize=0, 
    filename=0x4482 <Address 0x4482 out of bounds>, pool=0x4482) at shm.c:410

from "where" and/or "bt"
even with --enable-maintainer-mode

creator: ianh@apache.org
text:
can you attach the apr.h, apr_private.h, config.nice, and your httpd configuration.

this will help us determine your machine configuration.

also in
srclib/apr/test there is a program called 'testshm.c' can you run this test and
see if it also fails

Thanks
Ian

creator: robert@pophost.com
text:
Created attachment 2389
tar.gz of apr.h, apr_private.h, config.nice, and httpd configuration

creator: robert@pophost.com
text:
testshm dumps core as well, however the trace doesn't yield much:
Program terminated with signal 11, Segmentation fault.
Cannot access memory at address 0x40016e20.
#0  0x0 in ?? ()

I should probably note that this problem exists in some later versions of apache
1.x as well. (I'm currently running Apache/1.3.12 fine).

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
It has been a long time since there has been any activity on this PR :(

Please grab the latest APR (from CVS or the one distributed with Apache 2.0.46)
and see if testshm still dies on your box.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
If you still hit the problem with recent code, please re-open the PR.

I'm not aware of other people encountering this strange problem.  It is very
likely a system environment issue or something already fixed.
